definition: room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: A small dining room can be separated from the living room with a simple design.
sentences.chinese: 经过简单的设计就能在客厅里隔出一个小小的餐室。

sentences.english: Dining room is at ordinary times family dines jointly or the life space of repast of fete relatives and friends.
sentences.chinese: 餐室是平时家人共同进餐或宴请亲友就餐的生活空间。

sentences.english: The dining-room was an antechamber as well, and separated the two bedrooms.
sentences.chinese: 那餐室同时也是起坐间，位于两间卧室之间。

sentences.english: Starting into activity, he bundled the policemen into the dining-room doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他抖擞精神，把警察推到餐室门口。

sentences.english: Back in the dining-room she sat in her chair and rocked.
sentences.chinese: 她回到餐室，坐在摇椅里摇了起来。

sentences.english: They were put up in the boys' dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在男生宿舍的餐室里。

sentences.english: They followed her into the dining-parlour.
sentences.chinese: 他们跟着她走进了餐室。

sentences.english: For afternoon tea we pick the Hong Hock Eating House in Chinatown at random.
sentences.chinese: 对于下午茶，我们随机选了中国城的丰富餐室。

sentences.english: In Restaurant Xiang Cheng sell before.
sentences.chinese: 之前在香城茶餐室售卖。

sentences.english: There is special food for the sick in our dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 我们餐室有专门为病人准备的饭食。

sentences.english: He realizes there must be a cobra in the room.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到餐室里一定有条眼镜蛇。

sentences.english: We have a few kitchen things and a dining toom set.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一些炊事用具和一套餐室设备。

sentences.english: Her dining-room had the decency of clean bareness.
sentences.chinese: 她的餐室有清洁溜溜的规矩。

sentences.english: A small breakfast-room adjoined the drawing-room, I slipped in there.
sentences.chinese: 客厅的隔壁是一间小小的餐室，我溜了进去。

sentences.english: The reception area and the dining room have been stripped of their fixtures and fittings.
sentences.chinese: 接待区和就餐室的装置和设施都已经不复存在。

definition: cafeteria meal specially prepared for a group of visitors/set meal
teahouse/tea-stall with seats/tea-garden or teahouse seat
siu mei/spit-roasted meat dish in Cantonese cuisine
